korean: 오늘 저녁에 파스타 만들어 먹었는데, 생각보다 괜찮았어.
레시피는 유튜브에서 본 건데, 진짜 간단해 보이더라고.
물 끓이는 건 쉬운데, 면 삶는 시간 맞추는 게 좀 어려워.
알 덴테로 만들어야 맛있다는데, 솔직히 그게 뭔지 잘 모르겠어.
마늘은 듬뿍 넣었는데, 볶을 때 타지 않게 조심해야 해.
올리브유도 생각보다 많이 들어가더라고, 건강에 좋다고 하니까 괜찮지 뭐.
파스타 면 삶은 물을 좀 남겨뒀다가 소스에 넣으라는데, 그게 꿀팁이래.
파마산 치즈 갈아서 뿌렸는데, 이게 진짜 맛의 핵심인 것 같아.
후추도 갈아서 뿌리면 더 맛있는데, 너무 많이 넣으면 매워.
처음 만들어본 건데 의외로 맛있게 나와서 뿌듯해.
설거지가 좀 많이 나온 게 단점이긴 한데, 뭐 어쩔 수 없지.
다음엔 토마토 소스로도 한번 만들어보고 싶어.
요리하는 게 생각보다 재미있더라고, 자주 해봐야겠어.
english: I made pasta for dinner today, and it was actually pretty good, you know?
The recipe was from YouTube, and it looked really simple.
They said you just need garlic and olive oil, so I gave it a try.
Boiling water is easy, but timing the pasta is kind of tricky.
The package says 8 minutes, but you should check around 7 minutes.
It's supposed to be al dente to taste good, but honestly I'm not sure what that really means.
I put in lots of garlic, but you have to be careful not to burn it when sautéing.
It uses more olive oil than I thought, but it's healthy so whatever, right?
You're supposed to save some pasta water and add it to the sauce, which is like, a pro tip.
I grated parmesan cheese on top, and I think that's really the key to the flavor.
If you grind fresh pepper on it, it's even better, but too much makes it spicy.
It was my first time making it, and I'm proud it turned out surprisingly good.
The downside is there were a lot of dishes to wash, but what can you do.
Next time I want to try making it with tomato sauce too.
Cooking is more fun than I thought, I should do it more often.
